page.title: 13HEALTH:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: There are no pharmacists,GPs or hos- pital services in this block,so the inhabitants go to one of the nearby medical practices for primary care,or to hospitals in Norwich for specialist help;people needing physiotherapy may be sent to Beccles or Gt Yarmouth. There are GP surgeries at Bungay,Sax- lingham & Hempnall & any drugs needed are dispensed at these.Nearby dentists & chiropodists are at Bungay & Norwich.Most women go to Norfolk & Norwich Hospital for maternity care; home confinement is not encouraged.The elderly can go to a Day Centre at Hempnall,but if they cannot manage alone there are 'homes' eg.at Bungay, Ditchingham & Earsham,or geriatric wards at Whitlingham.Finally at life's end the nuns at a small hospital run by the Community of All Hallows,Ditch- ingham,provide loving care.
